availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Eliza Ann Cartwright Redd in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on September 10, 1840. Father of James W. Redd, George L.. Redd, Theodore Redd, John T. Redd, and Eliza A. Redd. Married to Mary Janes Hayes Redd in Fayette County on December 24, 1855. Father of Phillip Redd and Samuel M. Redd. Farmer in Trigg County in 1850. Employed Govy Brown as a laborer in Trigg County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850. Farmer in Trigg County in 1860. Owned eighteen enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1860.
